title: Blue Light Blockers and Sleep
content: Blue blocker glasses can improve sleep quality. Sleep is a balancing act between adenosine, cortisol, and melatonin. Adenosine builds up with the more energy you expend. Cortisol should be low in the evenings and melatonin should rise at night. Melatonin is secreted by the pineal gland in the absence of light, specifically blue light. Therefore, blocking blue light can help improve sleep.

title: Minimizing Jet Lag and Sleep Disruption While Traveling
content: To minimize jet lag and sleep disruption while traveling, it is recommended to immediately 'put yourself' in the destination time zone when you leave the place of origin. This can involve sleeping for a certain number of hours on the plane and staying up until a normal bedtime on destination time. It can also involve waking up early and going to bed earlier in the days before the trip, getting exercise, and avoiding caffeine on the day of the trip. Supplements such as phosphatidylserine and sleep remedies can be used to help induce sleep, and modafinil can be used to help stay awake upon arrival.

title: Treating Symptoms of PMS and Understanding Hormone Cycles
content: PMS is not 'made up' and is a legitimate response to a hormone issue. It is likely that in some women, progesterone withdrawal during the last part of the luteal phase is the problem. The female hormone cycle consists of two phases: the follicular phase, where the body prepares for the follicle to be secreted, and the luteal phase, where the endometrial lining prepares for a fertilized egg. Progesterone is the hormone that really matters here. It, along with estrogen, starts very low during the period. Estrogen peaks during ovulation, then goes down but has a second peak in the mid-follicular phase, then comes back down again.

title: Understanding Progesterone and Menstrual Cycle
content: Progesterone stays really low throughout follicular phase and does not start to rise until after ovulation when it prepares the endometrium. It then comes crashing down at the end but from a much higher peak because it rises much higher during the luteal phase. Due to the very rapid withdrawal of progesterone, some women experience symptoms of emotional lability, mood swings which typically goes away once her period arrives. People have suspected that there are different degrees of progesterone receptors centrally that may be part of why this is happening.

title: Interventions for Progesterone Withdrawal Symptoms
content: Interventions include better sleep, exercise, nutrition, time with friends. Pharmacological interventions include a very low dose of progesterone for women to take orally following ovulation, between 25 and 50 milligrams, which usually blunts all of the symptoms out. The drawback is that the woman has to closely monitor her cycle and time the dosage accurately for it to work. Another option is oral contraceptives which takes all of this fluctuation away and normalizes it but comes with its own pros and cons.

title: Hormonal Changes in Menopause
content: During menopause, estrogen and progesterone experience a rapid drop off, they effectively go to zero. Testosterone also drops to zero. Testosterone in women is actually much higher than estrogen and progesterone. Testosterone is the dominant hormone in both men and women. Testosterone also varies throughout a woman’s cycle but to a much less degree than other hormones.

title: Importance of Estrogen in Men
content: Estrogen is very important in men. If estrogen is too high or too low, it’s suboptimal regardless of the testosterone level. Some men just don’t genetically make much estrogen out of their testosterone and so their estrogen is low. In these men, you actually worry about reduced bone density.

title: Understanding Autophagy
content: Autophagy is when the lysosome of a cell basically auto digests the cell. Like most processes in the body, there must be balance. When there’s too much of it, or too little of it, really bad things happen. One of the more important reasons for doing this is to rid the body of cells that are suboptimal. Example of a suboptimal cell is a cell that’s got DNA damage.

title: Enhancing Autophagy
content: The most direct way to enhance autophagy is to fast. The deprivation of nutrients appears to be the most obvious way to induce autophagy. Drugs like rapamycin mimic fasting and enhance autophagy. Exercise also plays a role in enhancing autophagy. Sustained aerobic exercise is most of likely to push us towards more autophagy because it more closely mimics a nutrient deprived state.

title: Mitochondrial Biogenesis
content: Cells also have a mitochondrial homeostasis. Sometimes they say a cell needs to die, other times they say “just this part” of the cell needs to die, but this part can stay. And other times it says that we don’t have the supply to meet the demand so we’re going to make more mitochondrial DNA and make more complexes and increase our ATP capacity (mitochondrial biogenesis).

title: Mitochondrial DNA and Inflammation
content: If the mitochondria can die in a controlled process through mitophagy or apoptosis, it’s controlled, that’s great. If the mitochondria become damaged and lice their contents, namely their DNA into the cytoplasm, that becomes problematic. Mitochondrial DNA are bacterial in origin. So when mitochondrial DNA escape the mitochondria into the cytoplasm, that’s a real trigger to the immune system that something bad is happening. Demonstrating that the inflammation that’s found in aging muscles can be tied to mitochondrial DNA seeping into the cytoplasm.

title: Metformin and Autophagy
content: Studies showing type 2 diabetics that were taking metformin live longer than non-diabetic control. Metformin increases AMPK, so maybe part of the beneficial effects of metformin is increased autophagy. The data is much more clear on the beneficial effect of metformin on people who are metabolically dysregulated.

title: Sleep and Autophagy
content: In Matthew Walker‘s book, Why We Sleep, he wrote about the process of cleaning up cellular debris and how important sleep is for that process. There might be increased autophagy as well, where circadian rhythm is linked to autophagy and sleep fragmentation appears to disrupt this process in mice.

title: Ketosis, Beta-Hydroxybutyrate and Autophagy
content: Ketosis and beta-hydroxybutyrate sort of mimic fasting and that might help in this autophagic state.

title: Diet, Sleep, Exercise and Autophagy
content: Diet, sleep, and exercise might be beneficial for health as autophagy might be one of the mechanisms of benefit.

title: Monitoring Health Values
content: Lactate in real time, real-time beta-hydroxybutyrate for people in ketosis, and real-time insulin would be valuable health values to monitor if the technology existed.
